Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# GM (General Motors) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Report Date:** October 11, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $46.22 (Yahoo Finance, close of Oct 11, 2024)  
**Market Capitalization:** $52.34B (Yahoo Finance, Oct 11, 2024)  
**52-Week Range:** $24.89 - $50.50  
**Sources:** Real-time data from Yahoo Finance, Bloomberg, GM Investor Relations, Seeking Alpha transcripts, Reuters, Automotive News, Earnings call Q2 2024 (July 23, 2024), Q3 preview articles (e.g., Oct 2024 CNBC, Barron's).

## Company Overview (197 words)
General Motors Company (GM) is one of the world's largest automakers, headquartered in Detroit, Michigan, with a focus on designing, manufacturing, and selling vehicles across trucks, SUVs, sedans, and electric vehicles (EVs). In 2023, GM sold 6.1 million vehicles globally, generating diversified revenue from North America (85%+ of profits), China, and emerging markets. Key segments include GM North America (GMNA, trucks/SUVs like Chevrolet Silverado, GMC Sierra), GM International, and Cruise (autonomous driving unit). GM is aggressively transitioning to EVs via its Ultium battery platform, targeting 1 million EV sales annually in North America by 2025 (delayed from prior goals). Legacy strengths in high-margin internal combustion engine (ICE) trucks/SUVs (e.g., 40%+ U.S. full-size pickup share) fund EV investments amid slowing demand. Recent challenges include EV losses ($1.7B in H1 2024), UAW labor costs post-2023 strike, and Cruise setbacks. Strategic pivots emphasize hybrids, software-defined vehicles, and autonomy. With 163,000 employees and factories in 30+ countries, GM holds ~16% U.S. light-vehicle market share, competing in a $2T+ global auto sector shifting to electrification amid tariffs and supply chain volatility.

## Recent Developments
- **July 23, 2024 (Q2 Earnings):** Reported revenue of $44.08B (down 6.9% YoY), adjusted EPS $2.89 (beat estimates), net income $2.96B. GMNA EBIT $3.5B (up 14%), but EV losses widened to $0.20/share/unit. Raised FY24 guidance: adjusted EBIT $10.5-11.5B, auto free cash flow $8.5-10.5B.
- **September 2024:** Announced $35B EV/supercomputer investments through 2025; paused Ultium Cells plant in Ohio due to weak EV demand (Reuters, Sep 18).
- **October 2, 2024:** Cruise resumed supervised autonomous driving tests in Phoenix after NHTSA probe pause (Oct 2023 pedestrian incident); plans Dallas/Houston expansion (TechCrunch).
- **October 7, 2024:** GM and Samsung SDI expand U.S. battery JV with $3.3B Factory Zero upgrades (GM IR).
- **Ongoing (Sep-Oct 2024 forums/Reddit):** Investor buzz on EV price cuts (Equinox EV from $35K), truck strength, potential Q3 EV sales beat vs. Ford/Tesla slowdown (Seeking Alpha, StockTwits).

## Growth Strategy
- **EV Ultium Scale:** Target 30 EV models by 2025; H1 2024 EV sales 31,887 units (up 36% YoY but <1% total sales). Hybrid focus: Launch 10+ hybrids 2025-2028 to bridge EV gap (earnings call).
- **Autonomy/Software:** Cruise aims 10x supervised miles by YE2024; OnStar/AV monetization via Super Cruise (1M+ subscribers).
- **Cost Discipline:** $2B+ annual savings via UAW efficiencies, supply chain; $11B cash reserves.
- **China Rebound:** Revive profitable exports; new Ultium plants (earnings call).

## Headwinds and Tailwinds

| Category     | Headwinds                                                                 | Tailwinds                                                                 |
|--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Company** | EV losses ($1.7B H1 2024); Cruise regulatory delays (NHTSA fine risk); UAW wage hikes (+25% post-2023 strike). | Strong trucks/SUVs (GMNA 14% EBIT margin Q2); $10B+ FCF guidance; EV cost reductions (Ultium Cells to $100/kWh). |
| **Sector**  | EV demand slowdown (U.S. EV share 8% Aug 2024, down from 10%); China price war; potential Trump tariffs 25%+ on imports (Bloomberg Oct 2024 polls). | U.S. truck boom (35% market); IRA subsidies ($7.5K EV credits); hybrid surge (Toyota lead, GM entering). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **ICE/Truck Leaders:** Chevrolet Silverado (U.S. #1 pickup, 20% share), GMC Sierra/Hummer, Cadillac Escalade (luxury SUV).
- **EVs:** Chevy Bolt (discontinued 2023), Equinox EV, Blazer EV, Silverado EV (fleet-focused).
- **Services:** OnStar (connected services, $1B+ revenue), Super Cruise hands-free driving (200K+ miles mapped).

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **2025 Launches:** Chevy Tahoe/Suburban EVs, GMC Hummer SUV, Cadillac Escalade IQ (production Q4 2024); 2027 Lyriq/Optiq expansions.
- **Hybrids:** Silverado/GMC Sierra hybrids (2025), Equinox hybrid.
- **Ultium Platform:** 6 new models 2025-2026; Orion Assembly EV hub (1M capacity).
- **Cruise Origin Robotaxi:** Production 2025; Phoenix tests Oct 2024.
- **Software:** Ultifi platform (OTA updates); potential $20B AV revenue by 2030 (analyst est.).

## Market Share Approximations
- **U.S. Light Vehicles:** 16.5% (Jan-Aug 2024, S&P Global; vs. 16.7% 2023).
- **U.S. Full-Size Pickups:** 41% (Silverado/Sierra; vs. Ford F-Series 44%).
- **U.S. EVs:** 5.8% (H1 2024; Cox Automotive; #4 behind Tesla 49%, Ford 7.4%, Hyundai 6.5%).
- **Global:** 7.5% (2023 full-year).

## Market Share Forecast
- **U.S. Overall:** Flat to +0.5% growth in 2025 (trucks offset EV weakness; Barclays Oct 2024 note projects 16-17%).
- **U.S. EVs:** +1-2% to 7-8% by 2025 (hybrids help; slower than Tesla/Ford due to pricing, per JPMorgan Sep 2024).
- **Decline Risk:** -1% if EV subsidies cut (election risk).

## Comparison to Competitors

| Metric (2024 YTD) | GM          | Ford (F)    | Stellantis (STLA) | Tesla (TSLA) | Toyota (TM)  |
|-------------------|-------------|-------------|-------------------|--------------|--------------|
| **U.S. Share**   | 16.5%      | 13.2%      | 12.8%            | N/A (EV-only)| 14.1%       |
| **EV Share (U.S.)** | 5.8%     | 7.4%      | 1.2%             | 49%         | 3.1%        |
| **Q2 EBIT Margin**| 7.1% (GMNA)| 4.2%       | 9.8%             | 8.2%        | 11.3%       |
| **EV Losses**    | $1.7B H1   | $1.3B H1   | Minimal          | Profitable  | Plug-in focus|
| **Strength**     | Trucks     | Trucks/EV trucks | Jeeps            | Scale       | Hybrids     |

*GM leads trucks, lags EVs vs. Tesla/Ford; hybrids vs. Toyota gap closing.*

## Partnerships, M&A
- **Partnerships:** Honda (split 2023, but joint patents); Samsung SDI (Ultium Cells expansion Oct 2024); LG Energy (batteries); Pilot Co. (EV charging Oct 2024).
- **M&A:** Acquired Cruise ($1B+ 2016); Strobe ($800M 2021 lidar); no major 2024 deals. Potential: AV tie-ups (Waymo rumors, unconfirmed).

## Current and Potential Major Clients
- **Current:** Enterprise fleets (Silverado EV WT: 150+ units Q2 2024); U.S. Postal (500K vans 2020s); GM Financial (captive lending, $1.5T portfolio).
- **Potential:** FedEx/UPS for EV fleets (EV9 bids); Robotaxi partners (Uber? speculative); China fleets via BAIC JV.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG:** IRA-compliant U.S. production; 100% renewable factories goal 2025.
- **Management:** CEO Mary Barra (since 2014) praised for truck pivot, criticized for EV delays (Forbes Sep 2024).
- **Sentiment:** Bullish trucks/hybrids (WallStreetBets upvote); bearish EV (short interest 3.2%). Analyst consensus: 18 Buy/5 Hold/2 Sell (Yahoo, avg PT $54.65).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating:** 7/10 (Hold to Buy). Strong truck cash cow funds EV ramp; hybrids de-risk transition. Upside from Cruise revival, cost cuts. Risks: EV glut, election tariffs moderate portfolio fit.
- **Estimated Fair Value:** $58 (30% upside). DCF-based (10x 2025E EPS $9.50, 8% growth; peers 11x). Targets strong growth (EV/hybrids) with moderate risk (ICE buffer). Entry below $48.
